message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the task of finding the optimal compression of a polyline with straight-line segments and arcs, which is a problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of dynamic programming, which is a common technique in algorithms and data structures, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions noise filtering and feature recognition, which are applications in computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category. The paper also deals with optimization, which is a common theme in graphics and visualization, making cs.GR (Graphics) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes an improvement to the dynamic programming approach, which involves reducing the amount of arc fitting necessary, which is a problem in artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category.
